meanings.definition: A substance that makes something more fluid.
meanings.sent1: The chemist added fluidizers to the mixture to make it easier to pour.
meanings.sent2: The company developed a new type of fluidizers to improve the flow of their products.
meanings.sent3: The magical fluidizers turned the thick syrup into a smooth liquid with just a drop.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as fluidizers, melting the tension in the room like warm butter.
meanings.sent5: The artist used fluidizers to create a masterpiece that seemed to flow off the canvas.

meanings.definition: A device that makes something more fluid.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used the fluidizers to lubricate the gears and keep them running smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The new fluidizers in the factory increased the efficiency of the production line.
meanings.sent3: The comical fluidizers sprayed silly string instead of oil, causing laughter in the workshop.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a set of fluidizers, easing any awkwardness in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved with such grace, it was as if she had fluidizers in her shoes.
